verses.verse: (For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Maskil of David.) Give <S%H238><s%> ear <S%H238><s%> to my prayer, <S%H8605><s%> O God; <S%H430><s%> And do not hide <S%H5956><s%> Thyself from my supplication. <S%H8467><s%>
Give <S%H7181><s%> heed <S%H7181><s%> to me, and answer <S%H6030><s%> me; I am restless <S%H7300><s%> in my complaint <S%H7879><s%> and am surely <S%H1949><s%> distracted, <S%H1949><s%>

Because <S%H4480><s%> of the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the enemy, <S%H340><s%> Because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the pressure <S%H6125><s%> of the wicked; <S%H7563><s%> For they bring <S%H4131><s%> down <S%H4131><s%> trouble <S%H205><s%> upon me, And in anger <S%H639><s%> they bear <S%H7852><s%> a grudge <S%H7852><s%> against <S%H7852><s%> me.
My heart <S%H3820><s%> is in anguish <S%H9123><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me, And the terrors <S%H367><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> have fallen <S%H5307><s%> upon me.
Fear <S%H3374><s%> and trembling <S%H7461><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon me; And horror <S%H6427><s%> has overwhelmed <S%H3680><s%> me.

And I said, <S%H559><s%> "Oh, <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that I had <S%H5414><s%> wings <S%H83><s%> like a dove! <S%H3123><s%> I would fly <S%H5774><s%> away <S%H5774><s%> and be at rest. <S%H7931><s%>
"Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I would wander <S%H5074><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> away, I would lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the wilderness. <S%H4057><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
"I would hasten <S%H2363><s%> to my place <S%H4655><s%> of refuge <S%H4655><s%> From the stormy <S%H5584><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> [and] tempest. <S%H5591><s%>"
Confuse, <S%H1104><s%> O Lord, <S%H136><s%> divide <S%H6385><s%> their tongues, <S%H3956><s%> For I have seen <S%H7200><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and strife <S%H7379><s%> in the city. <S%H5892><s%>

Day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> they go <S%H5437><s%> around <S%H5437><s%> her upon her walls; <S%H2346><s%> And iniquity <S%H205><s%> and mischief <S%H5999><s%> are in her midst. <S%H7130><s%>
Destruction <S%H1942><s%> is in her midst; <S%H7130><s%> Oppression <S%H8496><s%> and deceit <S%H4820><s%> do not depart <S%H4185><s%> from her streets. <S%H7339><s%>

For it is not an enemy <S%H340><s%> who reproaches <S%H2778><s%> me, Then I could bear <S%H5375><s%> [it]; Nor <S%H3808><s%> is it one who hates <S%H8130><s%> me who has exalted <S%H1431><s%> himself against <S%H5921><s%> me, Then I could hide <S%H5641><s%> myself from him.
But it is you, a man <S%H582><s%> my equal, <S%H6187><s%> My companion <S%H9017><s%> and my familiar <S%H3045><s%> friend. <S%H3045><s%>

We who <S%H834><s%> had <S%H4985><s%> sweet <S%H4985><s%> fellowship <S%H5475><s%> together, <S%H9191><s%> Walked <S%H1980><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> in the throng. <S%H7285><s%>

Let death <S%H4194><s%> come <S%H5378><s%> deceitfully <S%H5378><s%> upon them; Let them go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> alive <S%H2416><s%> to Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> For evil <S%H7451><s%> is in their dwelling, <S%H4033><s%> in their midst. <S%H7130><s%>
As for me, I shall call <S%H7121><s%> upon God, <S%H430><s%> And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will save <S%H3467><s%> me.
Evening <S%H6153><s%> and morning <S%H1242><s%> and at noon, <S%H6672><s%> I will complain <S%H7878><s%> and murmur, <S%H1993><s%> And He will hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice. <S%H6963><s%>
He will redeem <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%> from the battle <S%H7128><s%> [which is] against me, For they are many <S%H7227><s%> [who strive] with me.

God <S%H410><s%> will hear <S%H8085><s%> and answer <S%H6030><s%> them – Even the one who sits <S%H3427><s%> enthroned <S%H3427><s%> from of old <S%H6924><s%> – Selah. <S%H5542><s%> With whom <S%H834><s%> there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> change, <S%H2487><s%> And who do not fear <S%H3372><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>
He has put <S%H7971><s%> forth <S%H7971><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> against those who <S%H7965><s%> were at peace <S%H7965><s%> with him; He has violated <S%H2490><s%> his covenant. <S%H1285><s%>

His speech <S%H6310><s%> was smoother <S%H9140><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> butter, <S%H4260><s%> But his heart <S%H3820><s%> was war; <S%H7128><s%> His words <S%H1697><s%> were softer <S%H7401><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> oil, <S%H8081><s%> Yet they were drawn <S%H6609><s%> swords. <S%H6609><s%>

Cast <S%H7993><s%> your burden <S%H3053><s%> upon the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and He will sustain <S%H3557><s%> you; He will never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5769><s%> allow <S%H5414><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> to be shaken. <S%H4131><s%>

But Thou, O God, <S%H430><s%> wilt bring <S%H3381><s%> them down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit <S%H875><s%> of destruction; <S%H7845><s%> Men <S%H376><s%> of bloodshed <S%H1818><s%> and deceit <S%H4820><s%> will not live <S%H2673><s%> out half <S%H2673><s%> their days. <S%H3117><s%> But I will trust <S%H982><s%> in Thee.
